alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 06 at 6:59AM PST until January 07 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW AND FREEZING RAIN TODAY... .Moderate to heavy snow is impacting the Inland Northwest this morning. Snowfall rates around Wenatchee, Chelan, Omak, and into the East Slopes of the Cascades have been very heavy and on the order of 1 to 2 inches per hour. All Cascade Passes are closed at this time. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 8 and 12 inches for the lowlands and 1 to 2 feet for the mountains. * WHERE...Eastport, Sandpoint, Colville, Northport, Bonners Ferry, Orin-Rice Road, Athol, Newport, Flowery Trail Road, Chewelah, Deer Park, Springdale-Hunters Road, Kettle Falls, Schweitzer Mountain Road, and Priest River. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions will impact the Thursday morning commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
